sn45.30:1.2: Then Venerable Uttiya went up to the Buddha … and asked him,
sn45.30:1.3: “Just now, sir, as I was in private retreat this thought came to mind.
sn45.30:1.4: ‘The Buddha has spoken of the five kinds of sensual stimulation.
sn45.30:1.7: I have spoken of these five kinds of sensual stimulation.
sn45.30:1.9: Sights known by the eye that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing.
sn45.30:1.13: Touches known by the body that are likable, desirable, agreeable, pleasant, sensual, and arousing.
sn45.30:1.14: These are the five kinds of sensual stimulation that I’ve spoken of.
sn45.30:1.15: The noble eightfold path should be developed to give up these five kinds of sensual stimulation.
sn45.30:1.16: What is the noble eightfold path?
sn45.30:1.17: It is right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.
sn45.30:1.18: This is the noble eightfold path that should be developed to give up these five kinds of sensual stimulation.”
